creator: Ladycartoonist
title: Mounting watercolor paper to board (for lasercutting or otherwise)
materials_required: 140# watercolor paper (can be heavier or thinner) in this case I'm using Arches.
description: This project outlines a technique to mount or stretch watercolor paper to a board, suitable for laser-etching, cutting, or adhering to other flat porous surfaces. The process uses acrylic matte medium to ensure a flat, stretched surface as the paper dries.
steps: Spray the watercolor paper evenly with water until the surface is covered with beads of water but not sopping wet. Use a brush or paper towel to evenly distribute the water.
Drizzle matte medium over the watercolor paper, then use a brush or paper towel to distribute the medium into an even coating.
Flip the sheet over and align it square to the board's edges before laying it down. Smooth out large wrinkles, but do not worry about air bubbles.
If edges aren't adhering, apply more matte medium (mixed with water) to the edges until flat.
Let the paper and board dry overnight. If the board warps, spritz the concave areas on the back of the wood with water and allow to dry, or use weights to flatten.
